gurmukhi: ik AimqM pRBw hY ] ik Aimqo qmw hY ] ik AklMk rUpM ] ik sB jgq BUpM ]324]
transliteration: Ki Amitan Prabhaa Hai|| Ki Amito Tamaa Hai|| Ki Akalank Roopan|| Ki Sabh Jagad Bhoopan||324||
translation: She was a unique one with infinite radiance; her unblemished beauty was the king of all the kings.324.

gurmukhi: jubxmX mMqR su bwlI ] muK nUrM pUrM au`jwlI ] miRg nYxI bYxI koklw ] sis AwBw soBw cMclw ]325]
transliteration: Joubanmaya Mantra Su Baalee|| Moukh Nooran Pooran Ujjaalee|| Mrig Nainibainikoklaa|| Sas(i) Aabhaa Sobhaa Channdhalaa||325||
translation: There was radiant glory on the face of that youthful woman; her eyes were like a doe and the speech like a nightingale; she was mercurial, youth and moon-faced.325.

gurmukhi: Gix mMJY jYhY cMcwlI ] miRdhwsw nwsw KMkwlI ] cK cwrM hwrM kMTwXM ] miRg nYxI bYxI mMfwXM ]326]
transliteration: Ghan Manjhai Jaihai Channdhalee|| Mrid-haasaa Naasaa Khankaalee|| Chakh Chaaran Haaran Kanthaayan|| Mrig Naini Baini Mandaay||326||
translation: Her laughter was like lightning amongst the clouds and her nostril was extremely glorious; she was wearing. Pretty necklaces and doe-eyed one had embellished her wrist nicely.326.

gurmukhi: gj gwmM bwmM su gYxI ] miRd hwsM ibDu bYxI ] cK cwrM hwrM inrm`lw ] liK AwBw l`jI cMc`lw ]327]
transliteration: Gad Gadmannd Karmaan Su Gadnee|| Mrid Haasan Baasan Bidh(i) Bainee|| Chakh Chaaran Haaran Nitmallaa|| Lakh(i) Aabhaa Lajjichanndhallaa||327||
translation: That woman of elephant-gait was like a fascinating heavenly damsel and that sweetly smiling lady uttered very sweet words; seeing her pure diamond necklaces, the lightning was feeling shy.327.

gurmukhi: diRVu DrmwN krmwN su krmM ] duK hrqw srqw jxu DrmM ] muK nUrM pUrM subwsw ] lK cwrI bwrI AMnwsw ]328]
transliteration: Drid(u) Dharmaan Karmaan Su Karman|| Doukh Hartaa Sartaa Jan(u) Dharamannd|| Moukh Nooran Pooran Soubaasaa|| Lakh Chaari Baari Annaasaa||328||
translation: She was firm in her religion and performed good actions; she appeared as the remover of suffering in the way as if she was a stream of piety; there was brilliance on her face and her body was completely healthy.328.

gurmukhi: lK cwrM bwrM cMcwlI ] sq Drmw krmw sMcwlI ] duK hrxI drxI duK dMdM ] piRXw Bkqw bkqw hr CMdM ]329]
transliteration: Lakh Chaaran Baaran Channdhalee|| Sat Dharamaa Karmaa Sanchalee|| Doukh Harni Harni Daoukh Dan|| Priyaa Bhaktaa Baktaa Har Chhandan||329||
translation: Dutt saw that beautiful and mercurial woman, who according to her actions was observing Sati Dharma (the conduct of truth); she was the remover of suffering and was loved by his beloved; she composed and uttered the poetic stanxas.329.

gurmukhi: rMBw aurbsIAw GiRqwcI ] A`CY mohxI Awjy rwcI ] liK srbM grbM prhwrI ] muiK nIcy DwmM isDwrI ]330]
transliteration: Rannbhaa Urbaaseeaa Ghritaachee|| Achchhai Mohaniaaje Raachee|| Lakh(i) Sarban Gadban Par-hdaree|| Moukh(i) Neeche Dhaamannd Sidhdaree||330||
translation: She was fascinating like the heavenly damsels like Rambha, Urvashi, Mohinin etc. and these heavely damsels, seeing her, bowed their faces and feeling shy, they went back to their homes.330.

gurmukhi: gMDrbM srbM dyvwxI ] igrjw gwieqRI lMkwxI ] swivqRI cMdRI ieMdRwxI ] liK l`jI soBw surjwxI ]331]
transliteration: Gaddharban Sarban Devaanee|| Girjaa Gadetrilankaanee|| Saavitri Channdri Indraanee|| Lakh(i) Lajji Sobhaa Surjanee||331||
translation: The beautiful ladies like Ganddharva women, goddesses, Girja, Gayatri, Mandoddari, Savitri, Shachi etc. seeing her glory felt shy.331.

gurmukhi: nwgxIAwN niRiqAw j`CwxI ] pwpw pwivqRI p`bwxI ] peI swc pRyqI BUqysI ] iBMBrI AwBwmw BUpysI ]332]
transliteration: Naagadeeaan Nritiaa Jachchhaadee|| Paapaa Paavitri Pabbaanee|| Pai Saach Preti Bhootesee|| Bhinbhari Aabhaamaa Bhoopesee||332||
translation: The Naga-girls,, the Yaksha women, the ghost, fiends, and Gana Women all were devoid of radiance before her.332.

gurmukhi: br brxI hrxI sB du`KM ] suK krnI qrnI sis mu`KM ] aurgI gMDRbI j`CwnI ] lMkySI BysI ieMdRwxI ]333]
transliteration: Bar Barni Harnisabh Doukhan|| Soukh Karni Tarni Sas(i) Moukhan|| Urgiga Ddhrabi Jachchhaadee|| Lankeshi Bhesi Indraanee||333||
translation: That comely lady was the remover of all sufferings, giver of happiness and moon-faced; even in the garb of Naga-girls, Gandharva-women, Yaksha-women and Indrani, she looked an extremely charming woman.333.

gurmukhi: diRg bwnM qwnM mdm`qI ] ju`bn jgmgxI suBvMqI ] aurDwrM hwrM bin mwlM ] muiK soBw isKrMjn j√çwlM ]334]
transliteration: Drig Baanan Taanan Madmattee|| Joubban Jagmagadisoubhvantee|| Urdhaaran Haaran Ban(i) Maalan|| Moukh(i) Sobhaa Sikhranjan Jvaalan||334||
translation: The eyes of that intoxicated youthful woman were tightened like the arrows and she was glistening with the radiance of youth; she had worn a rosary around her neck and the glory of her face seemed like the gleaming fire.334.

gurmukhi: iCqpqRI CqRI CqRwlI ] ibD bYxI niRmwlI ] AsupwsI dwsI inrlopM ] buD KwnM mwnM sMCypM ]335]
transliteration: Chhipatri Chhatri Chhatraalee|| Bidh Baininaininrimaalee|| Asoupaasidaasinirlepan|| Budh Khaanan Maanan Sanchhepan||335||
translation: That queen of the earth was a canopied goddess and her eyes and words were pure; she was capable of alluring the demons, but she was the mine of learning and honour and lived unattached.335.

gurmukhi: suB sIlM fIlM suK QwnM ] muK hwsM inrbwmM ] piRX Bkqw bkqw hirnwmM ] icq lYxI dYxI AwrwmM ]336]
transliteration: Soubh Seelan Deelan Soukh Thaanan|| Moukh Haasan Raasan Nirbaaman|| Priya Bhaktaa Baktaa Harinaam|| Chit Laini Daini Araam||336||
translation: She was good, gentle and a lady of fine features; she was giver of comfort; she smiled mildly; she was the devotee of her beloved; she remembered the Name of the Lord; she was alluring and pleasing.336.
